id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id to use for this output component.

*See also: [Slow PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/slow_pwm.html#configuration-variables)*

pin.docs:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin to pulse.

*See also: [Slow PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/slow_pwm.html#configuration-variables)*

turn_on_action.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when the load is turned on. Can be used to control for example a switch or output component.

*See also: [Slow PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/slow_pwm.html#configuration-variables)*

turn_off_action.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when the load is turned off. `turn_on_action` and `turn_off_action` must be configured together.

*See also: [Slow PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/slow_pwm.html#configuration-variables)*

state_change_action.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when the load is switched. If a lambda is used the boolean `state` parameter holds the new status.

*See also: [Slow PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/slow_pwm.html#configuration-variables)*

period.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The duration of each cycle. (i.e. a 10s period at 50% duty would result in the pin being turned on for 5s, then off for 5s)

*See also: [Slow PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/slow_pwm.html#configuration-variables)*

restart_cycle_on_state_change.docs:
**boolean**: Restart a timer of a cycle when new state is set. Defaults to `false`.

*See also: [Slow PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/slow_pwm.html#configuration-variables)*
